abstracts.cdata!:
Given the nature of the project,
            conceived and implemented as an emergency reconstruction
            project, it is rated as highly satisfactory regarding its
            physical aspects, for, its basic objective, to reopen the
            main transport network, and restart transport operations,
            was met. However, modest ratings in sector policies, and
            institutional development, demonstrate that long-term
            sustainability is uncertain, mainly due to the lack of
            commitment from the Government, in setting funding
            mechanisms for road maintenance, and, finalizing the Road
            Administration statutes. In addition, the railway sector
            requires appropriate management, and operational structures
            to meet its demands. The lessons convey that the
            establishment of the Project Implementation Directorate, was
            crucial (in spite of questionable enclave units'
            establishment) since, not only basic government functions
            were not yet established, but it may lay the foundation to
            re-establish central roles for future roads administration.
            Due to the donor diversity, the Bank took the proactive
            approach to "decentralize" coordination, in order
            to achieve implementation progress, which simplified an
            otherwise time consuming coordination. It is further
            suggested for emergency operations, to keep project scope
            and procurement simple, involving local industry and
            structures, in the implementation process, and, radical
            steps, such as privatization should be actively pursued.
